qas.question: What is the name of a political show shown on BBC in Northern Ireland?
What is the name of a Scottish soap opera?
What language does BBC Scotland provide programming for?
What is a well-known Gaelic program?
What is the name of a show from Northern Ireland broadcast all over the United Kingdom?
What type of program is Give My Head Peace, produced by BBC Scotland?
What type o program is Patrick Kielty Almost Live, shown on BBC Scotland?
What popular children's show does BBC Wales produce for its Gaelic-speaking viewers?
What type of program is River City, produced by BBC Northern Ireland?
What type of program is Chewin' the Fat, shown on BBC Northern Ireland?

context: Programmes, such as the <b5_0>politically fuelled<b5_0/> <a0_0>Give My Head Peace<a0_0/> (produced by BBC Northern Ireland) and the <b8_0>soap opera<b8_0/> <a1_0>River City<a1_0/> (produced by BBC Scotland), have been created specifically to cater for some viewers in their respective nations, who may have found programmes created for English audiences irrelevant. BBC Scotland produces daily programmes for its <a2_0>Gaelic<a2_0/>-speaking viewers, including current affairs, political and children's programming such as the popular <a3_0><b7_0>Eòrpa and Dè a-nis<b7_0/>?<a3_0/>. BBC Wales also produces a large amount of Welsh language programming for S4C, particularly news, sport and other programmes, especially the soap opera Pobol y Cwm ('People of the Valley'). The UK nations also produce a number of programmes that are shown across the UK, such as BBC Scotland's <b9_0>comedy series<b9_0/> Chewin' the Fat, and BBC Northern Ireland's <b6_0>talk show<b6_0/> <a4_0>Patrick Kielty Almost Live<a4_0/>.
